intro: Desmochaeta ciliata, commonly known as the hairy leaf spongeplant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation in humid climates.
